data.message: What if the natural disaster takes out power and cell towers? Just sayin

replies.message: Hey Wayne. There are a number of factors we'll take into consideration when deciding whether or not to activate Safety Check. We will focus primarily on the scope and impact of the event and we will rely on trusted sources, like government agencies and disaster organizations and experts, to help us get the information we need to make this decision. -Hailey
If that's the case, a chain of communication is also disseminated to the public so as not to create fear or confusion or panic.
What about in the case of terrorism? If there's an invasion and capture of the communication means, how can we secure the public trust and integrity?
My goodness, use it and trust it or dont. I think an entire company and government officials will have thought of way more than you could imagine already.
Cell towers have generators and battery backup. Unless it's on the ground, it will be fine.
What if aliens attack us and beam us up to there space lab?

I'm not sure of the situations in other areas but during the tornado emergencies here in Oklahoma we frequently loose cell capabilities for several hours. With so many people trying to call in an out all at once I guess it was just too much for our networks to handle.

In the Nspa quake last Aug there was no power in most of the city and county. We all had cell phone availability regardless of phone carrier.  Land lines worked on old phones. NO internet phones or internet worked. No power no internet based phones.
EMP will render this useless. Nice to know if there is a NATURAL disaster. They did well with Katrina, just sayin....
During Katrina cell phones went out but texting and the Internet was active.
Ask all the question you can. Don't let any one tell you anything different

My nieces job teaches what to do in the event of Natural Disasters, your best bet would be to have a number to call family in a different state,  you call them in the event of natural disaster, that person can tell loved ones you are ok, keeps phone lines open!!
It'll work great until the system gets overloaded like what happens after every event. I mean you ever try to send a text at a music fest? same concept

Jacovia Cartwright Do you know how many exploits hackers have found in company and government officials systems that could have been thought of already? We need to ask the hard questions because not everyone has the same perspectives to think of different things. My goodness we should use it and trust everything on the internet. Just as easily as he could not use it, you could have kept scrolling instead of bashing someone for a honest question.
I'll just make a post that says... I'm OK.  And send a text to my family.
